CHAPTER ONE [I]349-sweetheart first saw [him]268-a good ol' boy at [[my]349-sweetheart brother]269-my brother ’s wedding , at the back of [the reception tent]270-the reception tent . [He]268-a good ol' boy stood with the insolent , loose - jointed slouch of [someone who 'd rather spend [his]268-a good ol' boy time in [a pool hall]272-a pool hall]271-someone who 'd rather spend his time in a pool hall . Although [he]268-a good ol' boy was well dressed , it was obvious [he]268-a good ol' boy did n't make [his]268-a good ol' boy living sitting behind a desk . No amount of [Armani]71-armani tailoring could soften that build — big framed and rugged — like [a roughneck or a bull rider]273-a roughneck or a bull rider . [His]268-a good ol' boy long fingers , clasped gently around a champagne flute , could have snapped the crystal stem with ease . [I]349-sweetheart knew from a glance that [he]268-a good ol' boy was [a good ol' boy]268-a good ol' boy , able to hunt , play football and poker , and hold [his]268-a good ol' boy liquor . Not [my]349-sweetheart type . [I]349-sweetheart was interested in something more . Even so , [he]268-a good ol' boy was [a compelling figure]274-a compelling figure . [He]268-a good ol' boy was good - looking , handsome if [you]275-you overlooked the crook in a nose that had once been broken . [His]268-a good ol' boy dark brown hair , as thick and lustrous as mink fur , was cut in short layers . But it was the eyes that seized [my]349-sweetheart attention , blue even at a distance , a volatile color [you]275-you could never forget once [you]275-you 'd seen it . It gave [me]349-sweetheart a little shock when [his]268-a good ol' boy head mined and [he]268-a good ol' boy stared right at [me]349-sweetheart . [I]349-sweetheart turned away immediately , embarrassed to have been caught staring . But awareness continued to spread over [my]349-sweetheart skin , a heat so insistent that [I]349-sweetheart knew [he]268-a good ol' boy was still looking . [I]349-sweetheart drank [my]349-sweetheart champagne in fast swallows , letting the arid fizz soothe [my]349-sweetheart nerves . Only then did [I]349-sweetheart risk another glance . Those blue eyes glinted with an uncivilized suggestion . A faint smile was tucked in one corner of [his]268-a good ol' boy wide mouth . Definitely would n't want to be alone in [a room]276-a room with [that guy]277-that guy , [I]349-sweetheart thought . [His]268-a good ol' boy gaze moved downward in a lazy inspection , returned to [my]349-sweetheart face , and [he]268-a good ol' boy gave [me]349-sweetheart one of those respectful nods that [Texan men]278-texan men had raised to an art form . [I]349-sweetheart deliberately turned away , giving full attention to [[my]349-sweetheart boyfriend]279-my boyfriend , [Nick]285-nick . [We]280-we watched the newlyweds dance , [their]280-we faces close . [I]349-sweetheart stood on [my]349-sweetheart toes to whisper in [Nick]285-nick 's ear . " [Our]280-we turn next . "[285-nick] [Nick]285-nick was going to ask [Dad]1027-dad for permission to marry [me]349-sweetheart , a tradition [I]349-sweetheart thought was old - fashioned and unnecessary . But [[my]349-sweetheart boyfriend]279-my boyfriend was being stubborn . " What if [he]1027-dad does n't approve ? "[349-sweetheart] [I]349-sweetheart asked . "[285-nick] Drawing back a little , [Nick]285-nick grinned down at [me]349-sweetheart . " Still , [I]285-nick 'd like to convince [him]1027-dad [I]285-nick 'm not such a bad deal . "[285-nick] " [You]1980-you 're the best thing that 's ever happened to [me]349-sweetheart . "[349-sweetheart] [I]349-sweetheart snuggled into the familiar crook of [Nick]285-nick 's arm . [I]349-sweetheart thought it was a miracle that [someone]281-someone could love [me]349-sweetheart the way [he]281-someone did . [No other man]282-no other man , no matter how good - looking , could ever interest [me]349-sweetheart . Smiling , [I]349-sweetheart looked to the side one more time , wondering if [the blue eyed guy]283-the blue eyed guy was still [there]284-galveston , [I]349-sweetheart was n't sure why [I]349-sweetheart was so relieved that [he]283-the blue eyed guy was gone . [[My]349-sweetheart brother]285-nick [Gage]817-gage had insisted on a small wedding ceremony . [Only handful of [people]287-people]286-only handful of people had been allowed inside [the tiny Houston chapel]288-the tiny houston chapel , which had once been used by [Spanish settlers in the seven - teen hundreds]289-spanish settlers in the seven - teen hundreds . The service had been short and beautiful , the air suffused with a hushed tenderness [you]290-you could feel down to the soles of [your]290-you feet . The reception , by contrast , was a circus . It was held at [the Travis family mansion in [River Oaks]1-river oaks]291-the travis family mansion in river oaks , [an exclusive [Houston]23-houston community where [people]287-people told a lot more to [[their]287-people accountants]294-their accountants than [[their]287-people ministers]295-their ministers]292-an exclusive houston community where people told a lot more to their accountants than their ministers . Since [Gage]817-gage was the first of [the Travis offspring]296-the travis offspring to get married , [[my]349-sweetheart father]285-nick was going to use the occasion to impress [the world]297-the world . Or at least [Texas]3-texas , which in [Dad]1027-dad 's view was the part of [the world]297-the world most worth impressing . Like many Texans , [[my]349-sweetheart father]285-nick firmly believed if [[our]298-our state]299-our state had n't been annexed back in 1845 , [we]298-our probably would have ended up in charge of [North America]4-north america . "[1027-dad] As [all creation]301-all creation knew , it was a big checkbook . [[My]349-sweetheart father]285-nick , [Churchill Travis]75-churchill , was [a famous " market wizard]75-churchill , "[75-churchill] having created [an international energy index fund that had nearly doubled in its first]302-an international energy index fund that had nearly doubled in its first decade . The index included oil and [gas producers]303-gas producers , pipelines , alternative energy sources , and coal , represented by [fifteen countries]304-fifteen countries . While [I]349-sweetheart was growing up , [I]349-sweetheart never saw much of [Dad]1027-dad — [he]1027-dad was always in some far off place like [Singapore]5-singapore , [New Zealand]6-new zealand , or [Japan]7-japan . So when [he]1027-dad was around , [he]1027-dad took it upon [himself]1027-dad to give [us]314-us doses of reality , like spoonfuls of bitter medicine . When [[my]349-sweetheart mother]315-mother , [Ava]79-ava , was still alive , [she]315-mother was an annual co - chair of [the Texas Book Festival]316-the texas book festival and went for smoke breaks with [Kinky Friedman]80-kinky friedman . [She]315-mother was glamorous and had the best legs of [any woman in [River Oaks]1-river oaks]317-any woman in river oaks , and gave the best dinner parties . [She]315-mother was more than [he]320-a lucky bastard deserved , [he]320-a lucky bastard announced on more than one occasion . And then [he]320-a lucky bastard would give a sneaky laugh , because [he]320-a lucky bastard always thought [he]320-a lucky bastard deserved more than [he]320-a lucky bastard deserved . [Seven hundred guests]321-seven hundred guests had been invited to the reception , but at least a thousand had shown up . [People]287-people milled inside [the mansion]323-the mansion and out to the enormous white tent , which was webbed with millions of tiny white fairy lights and blanketed with white and pink orchids . The humid warmth of the spring evening brought out the pillowy - sweet fragrance of the flowers . Inside [the air - conditioned house]324-the air - conditioned house , [a main buffet room]325-a main buffet room was divided by a thirty - two - foot long ice bar laden with all kinds of shellfish . There were twelve ice sculptures , one of [them]321-seven hundred guests formed around a champagne fountain , another featuring a vodka fountain studded with pockets of caviar . [White - gloved waiters]326-white - gloved waiters filled frosted crystal cylinders with biting - cold vodka , and ladled caviar onto tiny sour cream blinis and pickled quail eggs . The hot buffet tables featured tureens of lobster bisque , chafing dishes filled with slices of pecan - smoked tenderloin , grilled ahi tuna , and at least thirty other entrees . [I]349-sweetheart 'd been to many parties and events in [Houston]23-houston , but [I]349-sweetheart had never seen so much food in one place in [my]349-sweetheart life . [Reporters from the [Houston Chronicle]10-houston chronicle and [Texas Monthly]11-texas monthly]327-reporters from the houston chronicle and texas monthly were there to cover the reception , which included [[guests]328-guests like [the former governor]330-the former governor and [mayor]331-mayor]329-guests like the former governor and mayor , [a famous TV chef , [Hollywood people]333-hollywood people]332-a famous tv chef , hollywood people , and [oil people]334-oil people . [Everyone]335-everyone was waiting for [Gage]817-gage and [Liberty]712-liberty , who had stayed behind at [the chapel]336-the chapel with [the photographer]337-the photographer . [Nick]285-nick was a little dazed . Coming from a respectable middle - class background , this was a shock to [his]337-the photographer system . [I]349-sweetheart had changed since going to [Wellesley]12-wellesley , [a women]338-a women 's college with the motto non ministrari sed ministrare . Not to be served , but to serve . [Gretchen]108-gretchen was country born and as tough as [any pioneer woman who ever crossed [the Red River]32-the red river on [the Cherokee Trace]411-the cherokee trace]410-any pioneer woman who ever crossed the red river on the cherokee trace . By all rights [Aunt Gretchen]108-gretchen should have been [a tragic figure]415-a tragic figure . [She]108-gretchen 'd been engaged three times , and had lost all three fiancés , the first in the Korean War , the second in [a car]416-a car accident , and the third to an undiagnosed heart ailment . Each time [Aunt Gretchen]108-gretchen had confronted the loss , grieved , and accepted . [She]108-gretchen said [she]108-gretchen would never consider marriage again — it was clear [she]108-gretchen was n't meant to have [a husband]417-a husband . But [Aunt Gretchen]108-gretchen found all the fun [she]108-gretchen could out of life . [She]108-gretchen wore bright shades of coral and red , and always matched [her]108-gretchen lipstick to [her]108-gretchen clothes , and [she]108-gretchen wore jewelry on every appendage . [I]136-oliver heard [Oliver]136-oliver 's voice between the loud throbs of the pulse in [my]136-oliver ears . After [you]745-i ’ve been systematically abused , [your]745-i judgment erodes to the point where it 's nearly impossible to make decisions . Small decisions are as tough as [big ones]2302-big ones . [You]745-i are so scared about doing the wrong thing , being blamed and punished for it , [you]745-i 'd rather have [someone else]360-someone else take the responsibility . For [me]745-i there was no relief in having left [Nick]285-nick . Whether or not [I]745-i was still with [him]100-carrington , [I]745-i was buried in feelings of worthlessness . [He]100-carrington had blamed [me]745-i for causing the abuse , and [his]100-carrington conviction had spread through [me]745-i like a virus . Maybe [I]745-i had caused it . Maybe [I]745-i had deserved it . Another side effect of having lived with [Nick]285-nick was that reality had acquired all the substance and stability of a jellyfish . [I]745-i questioned [myself]745-i and [my]745-i reactions to everything . [I]745-i did n't know what was true anymore . [I]745-i went to [the bathroom]571-the bathroom and inspected [my]745-i face in the mirror . [I]745-i had a black eye , but the swelling had gone down . [My]745-i jaw was still puffy and weird on one side , and [I]745-i looked like [I]745-i 'd been in a car wreck . "[798-you] [You]798-you 're in charge , [Haven]1994-haven . " CHAPTER FIVE In [Texas]3-texas there is an obligatory sixty - day waiting period after [you]798-you file a petition for divorce . At some point [someone in [the state legislature]2324-the state legislature]2323-someone in the state legislature had decided that a legally mandated cooling - off period was a good idea for [people who wanted a divorce]2325-people who wanted a divorce . [I]1994-haven 'd rather [they]2325-people who wanted a divorce had left it up to [me]1994-haven to decide whether [I]1994-haven needed cooling off or not . Once the decision had been made , [I]1994-haven wanted to get it over with quickly . On the other hand , [I]1994-haven made pretty good use of those two months . [I]1994-haven healed outwardly , the bruises fading , and [I]1994-haven started going twice a week to [a therapist]2326-a therapist . Having never been to [a therapist]2326-a therapist before , [I]1994-haven expected [I]1994-haven was going to have to lie back on a sofa and talk while [some impersonal white - coated professional]2327-some impersonal white - coated professional took notes . Instead [I]1994-haven was welcomed into a small , cozy office with a sofa upholstered in flowered yellow twill , by [a therapist who did n't seem all that much older than [me]1994-haven]2326-a therapist . [Her]2326-a therapist name was [Susan Byrnes]148-susan , and [she]2326-a therapist was dark - haired and bright - eyed and sociable . It was a relief beyond description to unburden [myself]1994-haven to [her]2326-a therapist . [She]2326-a therapist was understanding and smart , and as [I]1994-haven described things [I]1994-haven had felt and gone through , it seemed [she]2326-a therapist had the power to unlock the mysteries of the universe . [Susan]148-susan said [Nick]285-nick 's behavior fit the pattern of [someone with narcissistic personality disorder]2328-someone with narcissistic personality disorder , which was common for [abusive husbands]2329-abusive husbands . As [she]2326-a therapist told [me]1994-haven about the disorder , it felt as if [she]2326-a therapist were describing [my]1994-haven life as it had been for the past year . [A person with [NPD]149-npd]2330-a person with npd was domineering , blaming , self - absorbed , intolerant of [others]2331-others ' needs . . . and [they]2331-others used rage as a control tactic . [A bully]909-a bully or [someone with personality disorder]910-someone with personality disorder needs to keep [[their]910-someone with personality disorder victims]2333-their victims confused , off balance , perpetually unsure of [themselves]2333-their victims . That way [he]909-a bully or [she]910-someone with personality disorder could manipulate [you]912-you more easily . Gaslighting could be anything that made [you]912-you doubt [yourself]912-you . For example , [a bully]909-a bully would make a statement about something , and when [you]912-you 'd agree with it , [he]909-a bully 'd disagree with [his]909-a bully own original statement . During the occasional droughts , [Houston]23-houston got so dry that , as a local joke went , "[349-sweetheart] the trees are bribing the dogs . " But when it rained , it rained . And as [a virtually flat city built around bayous , [Houston]23-houston]2642-a virtually flat city built around bayous , houston had major drainage issues . During a heavy downpour , water collected high in [the streets]2643-the streets and flowed into storm drains , culverts , and bayous that directed the flow to the [Gulf of Mexico]59-gulf of mexico . In the past , [countless people]2644-countless people had been killed by flash flooding , [[their]2644-countless people cars]2645-their cars overturned or swept away as [they]2644-countless people tried to cross [the rising water]2646-the rising water . Sometimes flooding ruptured fuel pipelines , [sewer lines]2647-sewer lines , knocked out [bridges]2648-bridges , and made [major roads]2649-major roads inaccessible . A flood watch was announced after lunchtime , and later it was changed to an actual warning . [Everyone]131-everyone took it in stride , since [[Houston]23-houston residents]2650-houston residents were accustomed to flash flooding and generally knew which [streets]2651-streets to avoid during the evening commute . Late in the day [I]349-sweetheart went to a meeting at [Buffalo Tower]2288-buffalo tower to discuss a new online system for processing maintenance requests . [Vanessa]817-gage had originally planned to go to the meeting , but [she]817-gage had changed [her]817-gage mind at the last minute and sent [me]349-sweetheart instead . [She]817-gage told [me]349-sweetheart it was mostly an information - gathering meeting , and [she]817-gage had more important things to do than talk about software . " [I]349-sweetheart was pretty sure there would be hell to pay if [Vanessa]817-gage had a question [I]349-sweetheart could n't answer . So [I]349-sweetheart resolved to find out every last detail about the software program , short of memorizing the source codes . [I]349-sweetheart was relieved but puzzled that [Vanessa]817-gage had not mentioned one word about seeing [me]349-sweetheart at [the Harrisburg]1204-the harrisburg the previous night . And [she]817-gage did n't ask about [Hardy]1057-hardy . [I]349-sweetheart tried to read [her]817-gage mood , but that was like trying to predict the weather , an iffy proposition at best . "With[1344-the daytime occupants] most of [the daytime occupants]1344-the daytime occupants gone , [the building]2288-buffalo tower was quiet and a little eerie , doors locked and windows darkened . The lights , the hydraulics , everything stopped . [I]349-sweetheart let out a startled yelp as [I]349-sweetheart was left in complete blackness . "Phone , "[349-sweetheart] [I]349-sweetheart said aloud , trying to reassure [myself]349-sweetheart with the sound of [my]349-sweetheart own voice . " There 's always a phone in these things . "[349-sweetheart] [My]349-sweetheart groping fingers found an elevator speaker phone with a push button , all of it embedded in the wall . [I]349-sweetheart used it as a makeshift flashlight , shining the tiny glowing screen at [my]349-sweetheart surroundings to see where the water was coming in . As if [the entire elevator car]1352-the entire elevator car were submerged . But that was n't possible . [I]349-sweetheart was so cold that [my]349-sweetheart teeth were chattering and the bones in [my]349-sweetheart legs were aching . Except for the water pouring in , everything was quiet .
